resources.string: Rebuilt after the war. Apart from the royal apartments, the old seat of Polish rulers also houses an art collection with paintings by Rembrandt and Bernardo Bellotto
The vast park surrounding the summer residence of the last Polish king, Stanisław August Poniatowski, is where Varsovians like to go for longer walks.
The highest Polish monument, the living Museum of Socialist Realism
A summer residence of Jan Sobieski.Wilanów Palace is a true pearl of Baroque architecture in Warsaw.
A UNESCO world heritage site, the Old Town was established in the 13th century.
The Warsaw Rising Museum was opened on the 60th anniversary of the outbreak of fighting in Warsaw.
Museum dedicated to great polish composer and pianist.The purpose of the Museum is to transfer knowledge and high quality artistic experience.
The National Museum houses a wonderful collection of well over 830,000 objects from all epochs
The highest Polish monument, the living Museum of Socialist Realism
a museum that collects and presents collections related to the history of Warsaw. The museum\'s headquarters is located in eleven interconnected Old Town tenement houses
For some, a meeting place, for others a window to the world, for yet another silent witness to the history of the capital and an original place with the atmosphere of pre-war Warsaw.
Poland\'s first Neon Museum dedicated to the documentation and preservation of Poland\'s cold war era neon signs
A great place for a walk or a bike trip. Lookout, cafes and bars, pergolas casting shadow, sails in the shape of sails, mini-beach and trampolines
There are few places by Vistula River where you can take some rest
Harenda started her activity in the \'90s and is the oldest club in Warsaw. It is a place where there is always a calm and positive atmosphere.
It\'s a place that attracts with its party character. The neighborhood of Nowy Świat and Kredytowa streets offers interesting opportunities for clubbing.
If you like non-obvious places, Night Market is for you. The Old Main Railway Station in Warsaw has gained a new life thanks to the meetings of food lovers organized in summer Saturdays and Sundays
The biggest shopping center in Poland
Themes uprising shrines in most cases are similar - thanks for saving during the war, for the salvation of the disease, in remembrance or acknowledgment
Located between Warsaw\'s Mokotów district and the city center, the park is one of the largest in Warsaw
The Municipal Zoological Garden in Warsaw is a great green island in the middle of the city, a magical place full of interesting adventures.
The square was originally designed by 18th-century royal gardener Johann Christian Schuch as part of the royal gardens. Now it\'s popular point of meetings
The science museum standing on the bank of the Vistula River in Warsaw, Poland. It contains over 450 interactive exhibits.
The hall is a unique combination of interesting art, a traditional market with good quality food and regional products, restaurants and food stores.
